articles.title: Live EU cuts growth forecast as inflation soars - live updates - The Telegraph
articles.description: The European Commission has slashed growth forecasts for the eurozone in 2022 as surging inflation holds back the post-pandemic recovery.

articles.title: Russia begins military exercise that West fears is prelude for Ukraine invasion - The Washington Post
articles.description: Russia and Belarus say the Kremlin's forces will withdraw after the training operation, but U.S. and European security officials are not convinced.

articles.title: Breast cancer scans detected tumours in 40% of women with no risk factors - Hospital Healthcare Europe
articles.description: Breast cancer scans in women with no recognised risk factors identified tumours in 40% of cases highlighting a need to scan all eligible women
articles.content: Breast cancer scans for women with no recognisable risk factors for the disease has identified that around 40% of these women have a tumour, emphasising the need to continue scanning eligible women. … [+2964 chars]

articles.title: Study places Homo Sapiens in Europe earlier than thought - Jakarta Post
articles.description: Up to now, archaeological discoveries had indicated that Neanderthals disappeared from the European continent about 40,000 years ago, shortly after the arrival of their "cousin" Homo sapiens, barely 5,000 years earlier and there was no evidence of an encounte…
articles.content:
Homo sapiens ventured into Neanderthal territory in Europe much earlier than previously thought, according to an archaeological study published in Science magazine on Wednesday.
Up to now, archaeolo… [+4152 chars]

articles.title: Child's tooth 'earliest known evidence of modern humans in western Europe' - Impartial Reporter
articles.description: The discovery of the molar was made in a cave – known as Grotte Mandrin – in France’s Rhone Valley.

articles.author: Frank Jordans
articles.title: French cave tells new story about Neanderthals, early humans - Phys.org
articles.description: A hillside dwelling overlooking the picturesque Rhone Valley in southern France proved irresistible for our ancestors, attracting both Neanderthals and modern humans long before the latter were thought to have reached that part of Europe, a new study suggests.
